contentrichtext.text: {{Basketball team | team = Yunnan Bulls | color1 = black | color2 = red | logo = | pixels = | founded = 2004 | league = [[Chinese Basketball Association]] (CBA) | history = | arena = | city = [[Kunming]], [[Yunnan]], [[People's Republic of China|China]] | colors = Red, Black, Brown | owner = | coach = [[Ma Lianbao]] | championships = | titles = | cheerleaders = | dancers = | mascot = [[Bull]] }} '''Yunnan Honghe Bulls''' ({{zh|c=云南红河奔牛}}) or '''Yunnan Honghe''' or '''Yunnan Bulls''' were a [[basketball]] team in the South Division of the [[Chinese Basketball Association]], based in [[Mengzi, Yunnan|Mengzi]], [[Yunnan]] ({{zh|c=云南蒙自}}). They won the 2004 [[National Basketball League (China)|Chinese Basketball League]] (CBL) championship and were promoted to the CBA for the 2004–2005 season, replacing the disqualified [[Beijing Olympians]]. In the 2004–2005 season, the Yunnan Bulls finished in fourth place in the South Division and upset the North Division's [[Liaoning Hunters]] in the quarter-finals, but lost in the semi-finals to the [[Jiangsu Dragons]]. In 2005–2006 they again finished in fourth place in the South Division, but were eliminated by the North Division's [[Beijing Ducks]] in the quarter-finals. ==External links== * [http://www.hhrb.com Official website] * [http://sports.sina.com.cn/cba/team/yunnan/index.shtml Sports Sina Profile] (in Chinese) [[Category:Chinese Basketball Association teams]] [[Category:Sport in Yunnan]] {{CBA teams}} {{PRChina-basketball-team-stub}}
